title: Flawless Installation and Service

review_text: Network Performance Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 8 months: I need to share my overwhelmingly positive experience with Frontier Fiber. I signed up for their 500 Mbps fiber service 8 months ago after years of frustration with cable internet from my previous provider. The difference has been night and day. When the Frontier sales rep came to my door, I was skeptical because I'd heard mixed reviews about ISPs in general. However, she was transparent about pricing ($70/month with no price increases for 2 years), explained the installation process clearly, and answered all my questions without any high-pressure sales tactics. I decided to give it a try, and I'm so glad I did. Installation was scheduled within a week. The technician called 30 minutes before arrival (within my scheduled 8am-12pm window), showed up at 9:15am, and was incredibly professional. He walked me through where he'd run the fiber line, asked my preference for router placement, and completed the installation in about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber underground to my house, drilled a clean hole through the exterior wall, and mounted everything neatly in my network closet. He tested everything thoroughly, showed me how to access the router settings, and gave me his direct number in case I had any issues in the first week (I never needed to call). The speeds have been phenomenal from day one. I'm paying for 500 Mbps, but I consistently get 530 Mbps download and 517 Mbps upload on speed tests. What's even more impressive is that these speeds are consistent 24/7 - no slowdowns during evening peak hours like I experienced with cable. I work from home as a software engineer, so I'm downloading large code repositories, uploading builds to cloud servers, and on video calls constantly throughout the day. Frontier's symmetrical speeds (fast upload AND download) have been a game changer for my productivity. The network reliability has been outstanding. In 8 months, I've had exactly 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe thunderstorm, lasted only 25 minutes, and I received a proactive email from Frontier explaining the issue before I even noticed. The latency is excellent - I consistently get 3-5ms ping to local servers and 15-20ms to distant servers. This makes video calls crystal clear with no lag, and my kids who game online haven't experienced any lag or connection drops. I'm on video calls 4-6 hours per day, and colleagues have commented on how clear my video and audio are. The fiber connection just works reliably, day after day. Use Case: Heavy streaming and gaming household. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Overall Satisfaction (Primary) - Customer for 23 months: I'm writing this comprehensive review after 23 months as a Frontier Fiber customer because my experience has been so positive across every aspect of their service. I want to share the details because I know how hard it is to find honest, detailed ISP reviews. Background: I work from home full-time as a data analyst, so reliable internet isn't just convenient - it's mission critical for my livelihood. My spouse also works from home part-time, and we have 3 kids who use the internet heavily for online school and gaming. Needless to say, our household puts serious demands on our internet connection. Before Frontier, I was with a major cable ISP for 6 years. The service was okay but not great - speeds were inconsistent, there were frequent brief outages, and the price kept increasing annually. When I saw Frontier was installing fiber in my neighborhood, I researched extensively. The reviews were mixed (as they are for any ISP), but the technology (fiber vs cable) and pricing made me decide to give them a shot. SALES & SIGN-UP PROCESS: The Frontier sales rep who came to my door was professional and transparent. She explained exactly what speeds were available in my area, the pricing structure with 2-year price lock, and the installation process. She didn't use high-pressure tactics or make unrealistic promises. I signed up for the 500 Mbps plan at $70/month. INSTALLATION: Scheduled within 5 days of signing up. I got email and text confirmations with my installation window (8am-12pm). The technician arrived at 9:30am, right in the middle of my window. He was professional, explained what he'd be doing, and asked my preferences for router placement. Installation took about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (530 Mbps down, 527 Mbps up - exceeding the 500 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 510 Mbps down or 507 Mbps up. Most tests show 530+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 23 months, I've had only 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe storm with lightning in our immediate area, lasted only 20 minutes, and Frontier sent a proactive email explaining the situation before I even reported it. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support twice in 23 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once when I was considering upgrading my plan. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $74 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Work from home part-time (important). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Value & Pricing Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 8 months: After 8 months with Frontier Fiber, I need to share why this is the best value in internet service I've found. I was previously paying my old cable ISP $115/month for 300 Mbps download and 15 Mbps upload (and those were best-case speeds - reality was usually 180 Mbps down and 8 Mbps up during peak hours). When Frontier became available in my neighborhood, I did my research. Their 1000 Mbps fiber plan was $85/month with a 2-year price lock guarantee - meaning no surprise price increases after a promo period ends. I was skeptical because ISPs are notorious for advertising low prices that balloon after 12 months, but Frontier was very transparent. The contract clearly stated my price for 24 months, and it listed all fees upfront - just taxes and a small regulatory fee (about $4/month total). No equipment rental fees because the router is included. No installation fee. No activation fee. No surprise charges. I've been tracking my bills carefully, and every month has been exactly $85 + $4 in taxes/fees = $89 total. Consistent and predictable, which I really appreciate for budgeting. But value isn't just about price - it's about what you get for that price. And the value proposition with Frontier is incredible. I'm getting true fiber internet with symmetrical speeds - 1000 Mbps both download AND upload. Not advertised speeds that are actually "up to" speeds that you never actually achieve. I run speed tests regularly (I'm a data nerd), and I consistently get 1030 Mbps down and 1017 Mbps up. During peak evening hours (7pm-10pm when everyone is streaming), my speeds remain maxed out. No throttling, no congestion, just consistent performance. The symmetrical upload speed has been a game-changer. With cable internet, I had fast downloads but terrible upload speeds. Uploading work files to cloud storage, video calls, or backing up photos took forever. With Frontier's fiber, uploads are just as fast as downloads. I can upload a 5GB file in under 2 minutes. Video calls are crystal clear because of the high upload bandwidth. The network has been incredibly reliable - I've had zero outages in 8 months (compared to monthly outages with my previous ISP). No data caps either, which is huge. My household streams 4K video, games online, works from home, and we use hundreds of GB per month without any throttling or overage fees. When I calculate the value, I'm paying about $0.09 per Mbps of bandwidth, and getting rock-solid reliability. My previous cable ISP was $0.38 per Mbps with frequent issues. Plus, I'm saving $40 per month compared to what I was paying before. Over a year, that's $480 in savings while getting better service. Installation was free and professional. Customer service has been helpful the few times I've contacted them. Billing is transparent and consistent. The technology (fiber to the home) is future-proof and will serve me well for years. For anyone comparing ISPs, I can't recommend Frontier Fiber highly enough. The value proposition is unbeatable - you're getting premium fiber internet at a very reasonable price. No gimmicks, no hidden fees, just excellent service at a fair price. Use Case: Family with multiple users and devices. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Installation & Setup Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 4 months: I want to share my exceptional installation experience with Frontier Fiber because it set the tone for what has been 4 months of outstanding service. I scheduled my installation online, and the process was straightforward - I picked my plan (500 Mbps fiber), selected an installation date from available options, and chose a 4-hour window (8am-12pm). I received immediate email confirmation with details about what to expect. Two days before installation, I got a reminder email. The day before, I received a text message with my technician's name and estimated arrival time. On installation day, the technician (Mike) called me at 8:45am to let me know he'd be at my house around 9:15am. He arrived at 9:10am - early and ready to work. Mike was professional, friendly, and clearly very experienced. He walked around my house first to assess the best fiber line route. He showed me three options for how to run the fiber from the street to my house, explained the pros and cons of each, and let me choose. I picked the option that was slightly more work for him but would be least visible - he didn't complain or try to talk me out of it. He ran the fiber line underground from the utility pole, which took about 90 minutes. He trenched carefully, staying clear of my sprinkler system and landscaping. He drilled a small, clean hole through my exterior wall into my network closet (exactly where I wanted the router). Inside, he mounted the ONT (optical network terminal) neatly on the wall, connected the router, and organized all cables with proper cable management. He didn't just leave wires hanging everywhere like some installers do. After the physical installation, Mike tested everything thoroughly. He ran multiple speed tests from different devices, checked WiFi coverage in various rooms of my house, and helped me set up a custom WiFi network name and password. He showed me how to access the router admin panel, explained the different settings, and gave me tips for optimizing WiFi performance. He even helped me connect my smart home devices (thermostat, security cameras, smart TV) to the new network. The whole installation took about 3 hours, and Mike was meticulous about cleaning up afterwards. He filled in the trench, restored the grass, and didn't leave any trash or debris. Before leaving, he gave me his direct number and said to call if I had any issues in the first week. He also explained that Frontier would call me in a few days to make sure everything was working well. Sure enough, 3 days later, I got a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team. They asked if the installation went smoothly, if I was satisfied with the speeds, and if I had any questions. It felt like they genuinely cared about my experience. The 500 Mbps fiber service has been perfect since day one. I consistently get 518-538 Mbps download and 524-544 Mbps upload. The WiFi coverage reaches every corner of my 2000 square foot home. I've had zero service interruptions in 4 months. Working from home has been seamless with video calls, large file transfers, and multiple devices connected simultaneously. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Finally Reliable Internet

review_text: Customer Service Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 11 months: I've been a Frontier Fiber customer for 11 months and I feel compelled to write this review because their customer service has consistently exceeded my expectations. My journey started when I called to ask about availability in my area. The sales rep I spoke with was knowledgeable, patient with all my questions, and didn't use any high-pressure tactics. She explained exactly what speeds were available, the pricing structure, installation process, and contract terms. She even recommended the 1000 Mbps plan instead of the 1 Gig plan I was considering, saying it would be perfect for my household size and save me $15/month. That kind of honesty built immediate trust. The installation was scheduled for the following Tuesday. I received confirmation emails and text messages with the technician's estimated arrival time. He arrived right on schedule, was professional and friendly, and took time to explain everything he was doing. After installation, I received a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team asking if everything was working well and if I had any questions. That proactive outreach was impressive. About 3 months into my service, I had a question about my bill (just wanted to understand a line item - turned out it was the taxes/fees breakdown). I called customer support expecting a long hold time, but was connected to a representative in under 5 minutes. She was extremely helpful, pulled up my account immediately, explained the charges clearly, and even looked for ways to save me money. She found a promotion I qualified for that reduced my bill by $10/month and applied it right there on the call. The whole interaction took maybe 10 minutes and left me feeling valued as a customer. I also had to change my billing date once due to a change in my pay schedule. I used their online chat feature, and within 3 minutes, the agent had made the change and confirmed it would take effect next billing cycle. No hassle, no runaround, just efficient service. The proactive communication has been excellent too. When there was planned maintenance in my area, I received an email 5 days in advance explaining the maintenance window (2am-5am, so it didn't affect me) and what they'd be doing. When the maintenance was completed, I got another email confirming everything was done and thanking me for my patience. The speeds have been consistently excellent - I get 1047 Mbps down and 1048 Mbps up on my 1000 Mbps plan. The fiber service itself has been rock solid with no issues. But what really sets Frontier apart is how they treat customers. I've dealt with multiple ISPs over the years, and Frontier's customer service is head and shoulders above the rest. Use Case: Multiple family members working/studying from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Overall Satisfaction (Primary) - Customer for 6 months: I'm writing this comprehensive review after 6 months as a Frontier Fiber customer because my experience has been so positive across every aspect of their service. I want to share the details because I know how hard it is to find honest, detailed ISP reviews. Background: I work from home full-time as a software developer, so reliable internet isn't just convenient - it's mission critical for my livelihood. My spouse also works from home part-time, and we have 3 kids who use the internet heavily for work and entertainment. Needless to say, our household puts serious demands on our internet connection. Before Frontier, I was with a major cable ISP for 6 years. The service was okay but not great - speeds were inconsistent, there were frequent brief outages, and the price kept increasing annually. When I saw Frontier was installing fiber in my neighborhood, I researched extensively. The reviews were mixed (as they are for any ISP), but the technology (fiber vs cable) and pricing made me decide to give them a shot. SALES & SIGN-UP PROCESS: The Frontier sales rep who came to my door was professional and transparent. She explained exactly what speeds were available in my area, the pricing structure with 2-year price lock, and the installation process. She didn't use high-pressure tactics or make unrealistic promises. I signed up for the 1000 Mbps plan at $85/month. INSTALLATION: Scheduled within 5 days of signing up. I got email and text confirmations with my installation window (8am-12pm). The technician arrived at 9:30am, right in the middle of my window. He was professional, explained what he'd be doing, and asked my preferences for router placement. Installation took about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (1033 Mbps down, 1045 Mbps up - exceeding the 1000 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 1013 Mbps down or 1025 Mbps up. Most tests show 1033+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 6 months, I've had zero outages. Zero downtime is remarkable for any ISP and speaks to the quality of their fiber infrastructure. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support three times in 6 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once for help with router settings. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $89 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Family with multiple users and devices. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. title: Exceeded My Expectations

review_text: Network Performance Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 19 months: I need to share my overwhelmingly positive experience with Frontier Fiber. I signed up for their 200 Mbps fiber service 19 months ago after years of frustration with cable internet from my previous provider. The difference has been night and day. When the Frontier sales rep came to my door, I was skeptical because I'd heard mixed reviews about ISPs in general. However, she was transparent about pricing ($50/month with no price increases for 2 years), explained the installation process clearly, and answered all my questions without any high-pressure sales tactics. I decided to give it a try, and I'm so glad I did. Installation was scheduled within a week. The technician called 30 minutes before arrival (within my scheduled 8am-12pm window), showed up at 9:15am, and was incredibly professional. He walked me through where he'd run the fiber line, asked my preference for router placement, and completed the installation in about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber underground to my house, drilled a clean hole through the exterior wall, and mounted everything neatly in my network closet. He tested everything thoroughly, showed me how to access the router settings, and gave me his direct number in case I had any issues in the first week (I never needed to call). The speeds have been phenomenal from day one. I'm paying for 200 Mbps, but I consistently get 235 Mbps download and 225 Mbps upload on speed tests. What's even more impressive is that these speeds are consistent 24/7 - no slowdowns during evening peak hours like I experienced with cable. I work from home as a software engineer, so I'm downloading large code repositories, uploading builds to cloud servers, and on video calls constantly throughout the day. Frontier's symmetrical speeds (fast upload AND download) have been a game changer for my productivity. The network reliability has been outstanding. In 19 months, I've had exactly 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe thunderstorm, lasted only 25 minutes, and I received a proactive email from Frontier explaining the issue before I even noticed. The latency is excellent - I consistently get 3-5ms ping to local servers and 15-20ms to distant servers. This makes video calls crystal clear with no lag, and my kids who game online haven't experienced any lag or connection drops. I'm on video calls 4-6 hours per day, and colleagues have commented on how clear my video and audio are. The fiber connection just works reliably, day after day. Use Case: Work from home full-time (mission critical). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

The proactive communication has been excellent too. When there was planned maintenance in my area, I received an email 5 days in advance explaining the maintenance window (2am-5am, so it didn't affect me) and what they'd be doing. When the maintenance was completed, I got another email confirming everything was done and thanking me for my patience. The speeds have been consistently excellent - I get 541 Mbps down and 549 Mbps up on my 500 Mbps plan. The fiber service itself has been rock solid with no issues. But what really sets Frontier apart is how they treat customers. I've dealt with multiple ISPs over the years, and Frontier's customer service is head and shoulders above the rest. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Value & Pricing Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 17 months: After 17 months with Frontier Fiber, I need to share why this is the best value in internet service I've found. I was previously paying my old cable ISP $115/month for 300 Mbps download and 15 Mbps upload (and those were best-case speeds - reality was usually 180 Mbps down and 8 Mbps up during peak hours). When Frontier became available in my neighborhood, I did my research. Their 200 Mbps fiber plan was $50/month with a 2-year price lock guarantee - meaning no surprise price increases after a promo period ends. I was skeptical because ISPs are notorious for advertising low prices that balloon after 12 months, but Frontier was very transparent. The contract clearly stated my price for 24 months, and it listed all fees upfront - just taxes and a small regulatory fee (about $4/month total). No equipment rental fees because the router is included. No installation fee. No activation fee. No surprise charges. I've been tracking my bills carefully, and every month has been exactly $50 + $4 in taxes/fees = $54 total. Consistent and predictable, which I really appreciate for budgeting. But value isn't just about price - it's about what you get for that price. And the value proposition with Frontier is incredible. I'm getting true fiber internet with symmetrical speeds - 200 Mbps both download AND upload. Not advertised speeds that are actually "up to" speeds that you never actually achieve. I run speed tests regularly (I'm a data nerd), and I consistently get 242 Mbps down and 246 Mbps up. During peak evening hours (7pm-10pm when everyone is streaming), my speeds remain maxed out. No throttling, no congestion, just consistent performance. The symmetrical upload speed has been a game-changer. With cable internet, I had fast downloads but terrible upload speeds. Uploading work files to cloud storage, video calls, or backing up photos took forever. With Frontier's fiber, uploads are just as fast as downloads. I can upload a 5GB file in under 2 minutes. Video calls are crystal clear because of the high upload bandwidth. The network has been incredibly reliable - I've had zero outages in 17 months (compared to monthly outages with my previous ISP). No data caps either, which is huge. My household streams 4K video, games online, works from home, and we use hundreds of GB per month without any throttling or overage fees. When I calculate the value, I'm paying about $0.1 per Mbps of bandwidth, and getting rock-solid reliability. My previous cable ISP was $0.38 per Mbps with frequent issues. Plus, I'm saving $40 per month compared to what I was paying before. Over a year, that's $480 in savings while getting better service. Installation was free and professional. Customer service has been helpful the few times I've contacted them. Billing is transparent and consistent. The technology (fiber to the home) is future-proof and will serve me well for years. For anyone comparing ISPs, I can't recommend Frontier Fiber highly enough. The value proposition is unbeatable - you're getting premium fiber internet at a very reasonable price. No gimmicks, no hidden fees, just excellent service at a fair price. Use Case: Multiple family members working/studying from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

review_text: Overall Satisfaction (Primary) - Customer for 16 months: I'm writing this comprehensive review after 16 months as a Frontier Fiber customer because my experience has been so positive across every aspect of their service. I want to share the details because I know how hard it is to find honest, detailed ISP reviews. Background: I work from home full-time as a marketing consultant, so reliable internet isn't just convenient - it's mission critical for my livelihood. My spouse also works from home part-time, and we have 3 kids who use the internet heavily for streaming and video calls. Needless to say, our household puts serious demands on our internet connection. Before Frontier, I was with a major cable ISP for 6 years. The service was okay but not great - speeds were inconsistent, there were frequent brief outages, and the price kept increasing annually. When I saw Frontier was installing fiber in my neighborhood, I researched extensively. The reviews were mixed (as they are for any ISP), but the technology (fiber vs cable) and pricing made me decide to give them a shot. SALES & SIGN-UP PROCESS: The Frontier sales rep who came to my door was professional and transparent. She explained exactly what speeds were available in my area, the pricing structure with 2-year price lock, and the installation process. She didn't use high-pressure tactics or make unrealistic promises. I signed up for the 1000 Mbps plan at $85/month. INSTALLATION: Scheduled within 5 days of signing up. I got email and text confirmations with my installation window (8am-12pm). The technician arrived at 9:30am, right in the middle of my window. He was professional, explained what he'd be doing, and asked my preferences for router placement. Installation took about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (1023 Mbps down, 1028 Mbps up - exceeding the 1000 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 1003 Mbps down or 1008 Mbps up. Most tests show 1023+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 16 months, I've had only 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe storm with lightning in our immediate area, lasted only 20 minutes, and Frontier sent a proactive email explaining the situation before I even reported it. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support three times in 16 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once when I was considering upgrading my plan. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $89 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Work from home full-time (mission critical). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

I was skeptical because ISPs are notorious for advertising low prices that balloon after 12 months, but Frontier was very transparent. The contract clearly stated my price for 24 months, and it listed all fees upfront - just taxes and a small regulatory fee (about $4/month total). No equipment rental fees because the router is included. No installation fee. No activation fee. No surprise charges. I've been tracking my bills carefully, and every month has been exactly $50 + $4 in taxes/fees = $54 total. Consistent and predictable, which I really appreciate for budgeting. But value isn't just about price - it's about what you get for that price. And the value proposition with Frontier is incredible. I'm getting true fiber internet with symmetrical speeds - 200 Mbps both download AND upload. Not advertised speeds that are actually "up to" speeds that you never actually achieve. I run speed tests regularly (I'm a data nerd), and I consistently get 240 Mbps down and 239 Mbps up. During peak evening hours (7pm-10pm when everyone is streaming), my speeds remain maxed out. No throttling, no congestion, just consistent performance. The symmetrical upload speed has been a game-changer. With cable internet, I had fast downloads but terrible upload speeds. Uploading work files to cloud storage, video calls, or backing up photos took forever. With Frontier's fiber, uploads are just as fast as downloads. I can upload a 5GB file in under 2 minutes. Video calls are crystal clear because of the high upload bandwidth. The network has been incredibly reliable - I've had zero outages in 10 months (compared to monthly outages with my previous ISP). No data caps either, which is huge. My household streams 4K video, games online, works from home, and we use hundreds of GB per month without any throttling or overage fees. When I calculate the value, I'm paying about $0.1 per Mbps of bandwidth, and getting rock-solid reliability. My previous cable ISP was $0.38 per Mbps with frequent issues. Plus, I'm saving $40 per month compared to what I was paying before. Over a year, that's $480 in savings while getting better service. Installation was free and professional. Customer service has been helpful the few times I've contacted them. Billing is transparent and consistent. The technology (fiber to the home) is future-proof and will serve me well for years. For anyone comparing ISPs, I can't recommend Frontier Fiber highly enough. The value proposition is unbeatable - you're getting premium fiber internet at a very reasonable price. No gimmicks, no hidden fees, just excellent service at a fair price. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Customer Service Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 5 months: I've been a Frontier Fiber customer for 5 months and I feel compelled to write this review because their customer service has consistently exceeded my expectations. My journey started when I called to ask about availability in my area. The sales rep I spoke with was knowledgeable, patient with all my questions, and didn't use any high-pressure tactics. She explained exactly what speeds were available, the pricing structure, installation process, and contract terms. She even recommended the 200 Mbps plan instead of the 1 Gig plan I was considering, saying it would be perfect for my household size and save me $15/month. That kind of honesty built immediate trust. The installation was scheduled for the following Tuesday. I received confirmation emails and text messages with the technician's estimated arrival time. He arrived right on schedule, was professional and friendly, and took time to explain everything he was doing. After installation, I received a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team asking if everything was working well and if I had any questions. That proactive outreach was impressive. About 3 months into my service, I had a question about my bill (just wanted to understand a line item - turned out it was the taxes/fees breakdown). I called customer support expecting a long hold time, but was connected to a representative in under 5 minutes. She was extremely helpful, pulled up my account immediately, explained the charges clearly, and even looked for ways to save me money. She found a promotion I qualified for that reduced my bill by $10/month and applied it right there on the call. The whole interaction took maybe 10 minutes and left me feeling valued as a customer. I also had to change my billing date once due to a change in my pay schedule. I used their online chat feature, and within 3 minutes, the agent had made the change and confirmed it would take effect next billing cycle. No hassle, no runaround, just efficient service. The proactive communication has been excellent too. When there was planned maintenance in my area, I received an email 5 days in advance explaining the maintenance window (2am-5am, so it didn't affect me) and what they'd be doing. When the maintenance was completed, I got another email confirming everything was done and thanking me for my patience. The speeds have been consistently excellent - I get 235 Mbps down and 225 Mbps up on my 200 Mbps plan. The fiber service itself has been rock solid with no issues. But what really sets Frontier apart is how they treat customers. I've dealt with multiple ISPs over the years, and Frontier's customer service is head and shoulders above the rest. Use Case: Heavy streaming and gaming household. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.
title: Rock Solid Service

review_text: Overall Satisfaction (Primary) - Customer for 17 months: I'm writing this comprehensive review after 17 months as a Frontier Fiber customer because my experience has been so positive across every aspect of their service. I want to share the details because I know how hard it is to find honest, detailed ISP reviews. Background: I work from home full-time as a graphic designer, so reliable internet isn't just convenient - it's mission critical for my livelihood. My spouse also works from home part-time, and we have 3 kids who use the internet heavily for work and entertainment. Needless to say, our household puts serious demands on our internet connection. Before Frontier, I was with a major cable ISP for 6 years. The service was okay but not great - speeds were inconsistent, there were frequent brief outages, and the price kept increasing annually. When I saw Frontier was installing fiber in my neighborhood, I researched extensively. The reviews were mixed (as they are for any ISP), but the technology (fiber vs cable) and pricing made me decide to give them a shot. SALES & SIGN-UP PROCESS: The Frontier sales rep who came to my door was professional and transparent. She explained exactly what speeds were available in my area, the pricing structure with 2-year price lock, and the installation process. She didn't use high-pressure tactics or make unrealistic promises. I signed up for the 500 Mbps plan at $70/month. INSTALLATION: Scheduled within 5 days of signing up. I got email and text confirmations with my installation window (8am-12pm). The technician arrived at 9:30am, right in the middle of my window. He was professional, explained what he'd be doing, and asked my preferences for router placement. Installation took about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (516 Mbps down, 527 Mbps up - exceeding the 500 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 496 Mbps down or 507 Mbps up. Most tests show 516+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 17 months, I've had only 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe storm with lightning in our immediate area, lasted only 20 minutes, and Frontier sent a proactive email explaining the situation before I even reported it. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support twice in 17 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once when I was considering upgrading my plan. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $74 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Great Value for Money

review_text: Installation & Setup Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 8 months: I want to share my exceptional installation experience with Frontier Fiber because it set the tone for what has been 8 months of outstanding service. I scheduled my installation online, and the process was straightforward - I picked my plan (200 Mbps fiber), selected an installation date from available options, and chose a 4-hour window (8am-12pm). I received immediate email confirmation with details about what to expect. Two days before installation, I got a reminder email. The day before, I received a text message with my technician's name and estimated arrival time. On installation day, the technician (Mike) called me at 8:45am to let me know he'd be at my house around 9:15am. He arrived at 9:10am - early and ready to work. Mike was professional, friendly, and clearly very experienced. He walked around my house first to assess the best fiber line route. He showed me three options for how to run the fiber from the street to my house, explained the pros and cons of each, and let me choose. I picked the option that was slightly more work for him but would be least visible - he didn't complain or try to talk me out of it. He ran the fiber line underground from the utility pole, which took about 90 minutes. He trenched carefully, staying clear of my sprinkler system and landscaping. He drilled a small, clean hole through my exterior wall into my network closet (exactly where I wanted the router). Inside, he mounted the ONT (optical network terminal) neatly on the wall, connected the router, and organized all cables with proper cable management. He didn't just leave wires hanging everywhere like some installers do. After the physical installation, Mike tested everything thoroughly. He ran multiple speed tests from different devices, checked WiFi coverage in various rooms of my house, and helped me set up a custom WiFi network name and password. He showed me how to access the router admin panel, explained the different settings, and gave me tips for optimizing WiFi performance. He even helped me connect my smart home devices (thermostat, security cameras, smart TV) to the new network. The whole installation took about 3 hours, and Mike was meticulous about cleaning up afterwards. He filled in the trench, restored the grass, and didn't leave any trash or debris. Before leaving, he gave me his direct number and said to call if I had any issues in the first week. He also explained that Frontier would call me in a few days to make sure everything was working well. Sure enough, 3 days later, I got a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team. They asked if the installation went smoothly, if I was satisfied with the speeds, and if I had any questions. It felt like they genuinely cared about my experience. The 200 Mbps fiber service has been perfect since day one. I consistently get 249-269 Mbps download and 249-269 Mbps upload. The WiFi coverage reaches every corner of my 2000 square foot home. I've had zero service interruptions in 8 months. Working from home has been seamless with video calls, large file transfers, and multiple devices connected simultaneously. Use Case: Work from home part-time (important). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Couldn't Be Happier

review_text: Network Performance Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 9 months: I need to share my overwhelmingly positive experience with Frontier Fiber. I signed up for their 500 Mbps fiber service 9 months ago after years of frustration with cable internet from my previous provider. The difference has been night and day. When the Frontier sales rep came to my door, I was skeptical because I'd heard mixed reviews about ISPs in general. However, she was transparent about pricing ($70/month with no price increases for 2 years), explained the installation process clearly, and answered all my questions without any high-pressure sales tactics. I decided to give it a try, and I'm so glad I did. Installation was scheduled within a week. The technician called 30 minutes before arrival (within my scheduled 8am-12pm window), showed up at 9:15am, and was incredibly professional. He walked me through where he'd run the fiber line, asked my preference for router placement, and completed the installation in about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber underground to my house, drilled a clean hole through the exterior wall, and mounted everything neatly in my network closet. He tested everything thoroughly, showed me how to access the router settings, and gave me his direct number in case I had any issues in the first week (I never needed to call). The speeds have been phenomenal from day one. I'm paying for 500 Mbps, but I consistently get 517 Mbps download and 542 Mbps upload on speed tests. What's even more impressive is that these speeds are consistent 24/7 - no slowdowns during evening peak hours like I experienced with cable. I work from home as a software engineer, so I'm downloading large code repositories, uploading builds to cloud servers, and on video calls constantly throughout the day. Frontier's symmetrical speeds (fast upload AND download) have been a game changer for my productivity. The network reliability has been outstanding. In 9 months, I've had exactly 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe thunderstorm, lasted only 25 minutes, and I received a proactive email from Frontier explaining the issue before I even noticed. The latency is excellent - I consistently get 3-5ms ping to local servers and 15-20ms to distant servers. This makes video calls crystal clear with no lag, and my kids who game online haven't experienced any lag or connection drops. I'm on video calls 4-6 hours per day, and colleagues have commented on how clear my video and audio are. The fiber connection just works reliably, day after day. Use Case: Heavy streaming and gaming household. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (231 Mbps down, 235 Mbps up - exceeding the 200 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 211 Mbps down or 215 Mbps up. Most tests show 231+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 12 months, I've had zero outages. Zero downtime is remarkable for any ISP and speaks to the quality of their fiber infrastructure. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support twice in 12 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once when I was considering upgrading my plan. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $54 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Best ISP I've Ever Had

review_text: Customer Service Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 7 months: I've been a Frontier Fiber customer for 7 months and I feel compelled to write this review because their customer service has consistently exceeded my expectations. My journey started when I called to ask about availability in my area. The sales rep I spoke with was knowledgeable, patient with all my questions, and didn't use any high-pressure tactics. She explained exactly what speeds were available, the pricing structure, installation process, and contract terms. She even recommended the 1000 Mbps plan instead of the 1 Gig plan I was considering, saying it would be perfect for my household size and save me $15/month. That kind of honesty built immediate trust. The installation was scheduled for the following Tuesday. I received confirmation emails and text messages with the technician's estimated arrival time. He arrived right on schedule, was professional and friendly, and took time to explain everything he was doing. After installation, I received a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team asking if everything was working well and if I had any questions. That proactive outreach was impressive. About 3 months into my service, I had a question about my bill (just wanted to understand a line item - turned out it was the taxes/fees breakdown). I called customer support expecting a long hold time, but was connected to a representative in under 5 minutes. She was extremely helpful, pulled up my account immediately, explained the charges clearly, and even looked for ways to save me money. She found a promotion I qualified for that reduced my bill by $10/month and applied it right there on the call. The whole interaction took maybe 10 minutes and left me feeling valued as a customer. I also had to change my billing date once due to a change in my pay schedule. I used their online chat feature, and within 3 minutes, the agent had made the change and confirmed it would take effect next billing cycle. No hassle, no runaround, just efficient service. The proactive communication has been excellent too. When there was planned maintenance in my area, I received an email 5 days in advance explaining the maintenance window (2am-5am, so it didn't affect me) and what they'd be doing. When the maintenance was completed, I got another email confirming everything was done and thanking me for my patience. The speeds have been consistently excellent - I get 1026 Mbps down and 1029 Mbps up on my 1000 Mbps plan. The fiber service itself has been rock solid with no issues. But what really sets Frontier apart is how they treat customers. I've dealt with multiple ISPs over the years, and Frontier's customer service is head and shoulders above the rest. Use Case: Family with multiple users and devices. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Outstanding Experience

review_text: Network Performance Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 16 months: I need to share my overwhelmingly positive experience with Frontier Fiber. I signed up for their 1000 Mbps fiber service 16 months ago after years of frustration with cable internet from my previous provider. The difference has been night and day. When the Frontier sales rep came to my door, I was skeptical because I'd heard mixed reviews about ISPs in general. However, she was transparent about pricing ($85/month with no price increases for 2 years), explained the installation process clearly, and answered all my questions without any high-pressure sales tactics. I decided to give it a try, and I'm so glad I did. Installation was scheduled within a week. The technician called 30 minutes before arrival (within my scheduled 8am-12pm window), showed up at 9:15am, and was incredibly professional. He walked me through where he'd run the fiber line, asked my preference for router placement, and completed the installation in about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber underground to my house, drilled a clean hole through the exterior wall, and mounted everything neatly in my network closet. He tested everything thoroughly, showed me how to access the router settings, and gave me his direct number in case I had any issues in the first week (I never needed to call). The speeds have been phenomenal from day one. I'm paying for 1000 Mbps, but I consistently get 1049 Mbps download and 1037 Mbps upload on speed tests. What's even more impressive is that these speeds are consistent 24/7 - no slowdowns during evening peak hours like I experienced with cable. I work from home as a software engineer, so I'm downloading large code repositories, uploading builds to cloud servers, and on video calls constantly throughout the day. Frontier's symmetrical speeds (fast upload AND download) have been a game changer for my productivity. The network reliability has been outstanding. In 16 months, I've had exactly 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe thunderstorm, lasted only 25 minutes, and I received a proactive email from Frontier explaining the issue before I even noticed. The latency is excellent - I consistently get 3-5ms ping to local servers and 15-20ms to distant servers. This makes video calls crystal clear with no lag, and my kids who game online haven't experienced any lag or connection drops. I'm on video calls 4-6 hours per day, and colleagues have commented on how clear my video and audio are. The fiber connection just works reliably, day after day. Use Case: Work from home part-time (important). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

Installation & Setup Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 19 months: I want to share my exceptional installation experience with Frontier Fiber because it set the tone for what has been 19 months of outstanding service. I scheduled my installation online, and the process was straightforward - I picked my plan (200 Mbps fiber), selected an installation date from available options, and chose a 4-hour window (8am-12pm). I received immediate email confirmation with details about what to expect. Two days before installation, I got a reminder email. The day before, I received a text message with my technician's name and estimated arrival time. On installation day, the technician (Mike) called me at 8:45am to let me know he'd be at my house around 9:15am. He arrived at 9:10am - early and ready to work. Mike was professional, friendly, and clearly very experienced. He walked around my house first to assess the best fiber line route. He showed me three options for how to run the fiber from the street to my house, explained the pros and cons of each, and let me choose. I picked the option that was slightly more work for him but would be least visible - he didn't complain or try to talk me out of it. He ran the fiber line underground from the utility pole, which took about 90 minutes. He trenched carefully, staying clear of my sprinkler system and landscaping. He drilled a small, clean hole through my exterior wall into my network closet (exactly where I wanted the router). Inside, he mounted the ONT (optical network terminal) neatly on the wall, connected the router, and organized all cables with proper cable management. He didn't just leave wires hanging everywhere like some installers do. After the physical installation, Mike tested everything thoroughly. He ran multiple speed tests from different devices, checked WiFi coverage in various rooms of my house, and helped me set up a custom WiFi network name and password. He showed me how to access the router admin panel, explained the different settings, and gave me tips for optimizing WiFi performance. He even helped me connect my smart home devices (thermostat, security cameras, smart TV) to the new network. The whole installation took about 3 hours, and Mike was meticulous about cleaning up afterwards. He filled in the trench, restored the grass, and didn't leave any trash or debris. Before leaving, he gave me his direct number and said to call if I had any issues in the first week. He also explained that Frontier would call me in a few days to make sure everything was working well. Sure enough, 3 days later, I got a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team. They asked if the installation went smoothly, if I was satisfied with the speeds, and if I had any questions. It felt like they genuinely cared about my experience. The 200 Mbps fiber service has been perfect since day one. I consistently get 248-268 Mbps download and 223-243 Mbps upload. The WiFi coverage reaches every corner of my 2000 square foot home. I've had zero service interruptions in 19 months. Working from home has been seamless with video calls, large file transfers, and multiple devices connected simultaneously. Use Case: Family with multiple users and devices. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

title: Rock Solid Service

review_text: Installation & Setup Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 17 months: I want to share my exceptional installation experience with Frontier Fiber because it set the tone for what has been 17 months of outstanding service. I scheduled my installation online, and the process was straightforward - I picked my plan (1000 Mbps fiber), selected an installation date from available options, and chose a 4-hour window (8am-12pm). I received immediate email confirmation with details about what to expect. Two days before installation, I got a reminder email. The day before, I received a text message with my technician's name and estimated arrival time. On installation day, the technician (Mike) called me at 8:45am to let me know he'd be at my house around 9:15am. He arrived at 9:10am - early and ready to work. Mike was professional, friendly, and clearly very experienced. He walked around my house first to assess the best fiber line route. He showed me three options for how to run the fiber from the street to my house, explained the pros and cons of each, and let me choose. I picked the option that was slightly more work for him but would be least visible - he didn't complain or try to talk me out of it. He ran the fiber line underground from the utility pole, which took about 90 minutes. He trenched carefully, staying clear of my sprinkler system and landscaping. He drilled a small, clean hole through my exterior wall into my network closet (exactly where I wanted the router). Inside, he mounted the ONT (optical network terminal) neatly on the wall, connected the router, and organized all cables with proper cable management. He didn't just leave wires hanging everywhere like some installers do. After the physical installation, Mike tested everything thoroughly. He ran multiple speed tests from different devices, checked WiFi coverage in various rooms of my house, and helped me set up a custom WiFi network name and password. He showed me how to access the router admin panel, explained the different settings, and gave me tips for optimizing WiFi performance. He even helped me connect my smart home devices (thermostat, security cameras, smart TV) to the new network. The whole installation took about 3 hours, and Mike was meticulous about cleaning up afterwards. He filled in the trench, restored the grass, and didn't leave any trash or debris. Before leaving, he gave me his direct number and said to call if I had any issues in the first week. He also explained that Frontier would call me in a few days to make sure everything was working well. Sure enough, 3 days later, I got a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team. They asked if the installation went smoothly, if I was satisfied with the speeds, and if I had any questions. It felt like they genuinely cared about my experience. The 1000 Mbps fiber service has been perfect since day one. I consistently get 1025-1045 Mbps download and 1017-1037 Mbps upload. The WiFi coverage reaches every corner of my 3000 square foot home. I've had zero service interruptions in 17 months. Working from home has been seamless with video calls, large file transfers, and multiple devices connected simultaneously. Use Case: Work from home part-time (important). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.
title: Finally Reliable Internet

review_text: Value & Pricing Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 13 months: After 13 months with Frontier Fiber, I need to share why this is the best value in internet service I've found. I was previously paying my old cable ISP $115/month for 300 Mbps download and 15 Mbps upload (and those were best-case speeds - reality was usually 180 Mbps down and 8 Mbps up during peak hours). When Frontier became available in my neighborhood, I did my research. Their 200 Mbps fiber plan was $50/month with a 2-year price lock guarantee - meaning no surprise price increases after a promo period ends. I was skeptical because ISPs are notorious for advertising low prices that balloon after 12 months, but Frontier was very transparent. The contract clearly stated my price for 24 months, and it listed all fees upfront - just taxes and a small regulatory fee (about $4/month total). No equipment rental fees because the router is included. No installation fee. No activation fee. No surprise charges. I've been tracking my bills carefully, and every month has been exactly $50 + $4 in taxes/fees = $54 total. Consistent and predictable, which I really appreciate for budgeting. But value isn't just about price - it's about what you get for that price. And the value proposition with Frontier is incredible. I'm getting true fiber internet with symmetrical speeds - 200 Mbps both download AND upload. Not advertised speeds that are actually "up to" speeds that you never actually achieve. I run speed tests regularly (I'm a data nerd), and I consistently get 246 Mbps down and 241 Mbps up. During peak evening hours (7pm-10pm when everyone is streaming), my speeds remain maxed out. No throttling, no congestion, just consistent performance. The symmetrical upload speed has been a game-changer. With cable internet, I had fast downloads but terrible upload speeds. Uploading work files to cloud storage, video calls, or backing up photos took forever. With Frontier's fiber, uploads are just as fast as downloads. I can upload a 5GB file in under 2 minutes. Video calls are crystal clear because of the high upload bandwidth. The network has been incredibly reliable - I've had zero outages in 13 months (compared to monthly outages with my previous ISP). No data caps either, which is huge. My household streams 4K video, games online, works from home, and we use hundreds of GB per month without any throttling or overage fees. When I calculate the value, I'm paying about $0.1 per Mbps of bandwidth, and getting rock-solid reliability. My previous cable ISP was $0.38 per Mbps with frequent issues. Plus, I'm saving $40 per month compared to what I was paying before. Over a year, that's $480 in savings while getting better service. Installation was free and professional. Customer service has been helpful the few times I've contacted them. Billing is transparent and consistent. The technology (fiber to the home) is future-proof and will serve me well for years. For anyone comparing ISPs, I can't recommend Frontier Fiber highly enough. The value proposition is unbeatable - you're getting premium fiber internet at a very reasonable price. No gimmicks, no hidden fees, just excellent service at a fair price. Use Case: Small business owner working from home. Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.
title: Superior to Cable

review_text: Overall Satisfaction (Primary) - Customer for 22 months: I'm writing this comprehensive review after 22 months as a Frontier Fiber customer because my experience has been so positive across every aspect of their service. I want to share the details because I know how hard it is to find honest, detailed ISP reviews. Background: I work from home full-time as a video editor, so reliable internet isn't just convenient - it's mission critical for my livelihood. My spouse also works from home part-time, and we have elderly parents living with us who use the internet heavily for work and entertainment. Needless to say, our household puts serious demands on our internet connection. Before Frontier, I was with a major cable ISP for 6 years. The service was okay but not great - speeds were inconsistent, there were frequent brief outages, and the price kept increasing annually. When I saw Frontier was installing fiber in my neighborhood, I researched extensively. The reviews were mixed (as they are for any ISP), but the technology (fiber vs cable) and pricing made me decide to give them a shot. SALES & SIGN-UP PROCESS: The Frontier sales rep who came to my door was professional and transparent. She explained exactly what speeds were available in my area, the pricing structure with 2-year price lock, and the installation process. She didn't use high-pressure tactics or make unrealistic promises. I signed up for the 1000 Mbps plan at $85/month. INSTALLATION: Scheduled within 5 days of signing up. I got email and text confirmations with my installation window (8am-12pm). The technician arrived at 9:30am, right in the middle of my window. He was professional, explained what he'd be doing, and asked my preferences for router placement. Installation took about 2.5 hours. He ran the fiber line underground (not across my yard), drilled a small, clean hole for the entry point, and mounted everything neatly in my utility closet. He tested the connection thoroughly, showed me the speed test results (1049 Mbps down, 1015 Mbps up - exceeding the 1000 Mbps I'm paying for), helped me set up my WiFi network, and even helped connect some of my smart home devices. He cleaned up everything and left no mess. NETWORK PERFORMANCE: This is where Frontier really shines. The speeds are consistently excellent. I run speed tests weekly just to track performance, and I've never seen my speeds drop below 1029 Mbps down or 995 Mbps up. Most tests show 1049+ Mbps in both directions. What's impressive is the consistency - 8am or 8pm, Monday or Saturday, the speeds are always maxed out. No peak-hour slowdowns. The symmetrical speeds (equal download and upload) have been transformative for working from home. Video calls are crisp with no lag. Uploading work files is fast. Screen sharing is smooth. I can run a video call while my spouse is on a separate call and the kids are streaming, and everything works without any buffering or quality drops. The latency is excellent - I get 3-6ms ping to local servers, which is perfect for real-time applications. RELIABILITY: In 22 months, I've had only 1 brief outage. That one outage was during a severe storm with lightning in our immediate area, lasted only 20 minutes, and Frontier sent a proactive email explaining the situation before I even reported it. My previous cable ISP had outages monthly. CUSTOMER SERVICE: I've contacted Frontier support twice in 22 months - once with a billing question, once to change my billing date, and once when I was considering upgrading my plan. Each time, wait times were under 10 minutes, and the representatives were knowledgeable, friendly, and actually solved my issues on the first contact. No transfers, no callbacks that never came, no reading from scripts - just genuine help. BILLING & VALUE: My bill is consistent every month - $89 (base price plus taxes/fees). No surprise charges, no price increases after a promo period, no equipment rental fees. It's refreshing to have transparent, predictable billing. The value is excellent - I'm paying less than I did for cable internet while getting significantly faster speeds and better reliability. OVERALL: Every aspect of my Frontier experience has been positive. Professional installation, excellent network performance, reliable service, helpful customer service, and fair pricing. It's rare to be genuinely satisfied with an ISP, but Frontier has earned my loyalty and my recommendation. If Frontier Fiber is available in your area and you're considering switching, I highly recommend giving them a try. The fiber technology is superior to cable, the pricing is competitive, and in my experience, they deliver on their promises. Use Case: Work from home full-time (mission critical). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.

review_text: Customer Service Excellence (Primary) - Customer for 9 months: I've been a Frontier Fiber customer for 9 months and I feel compelled to write this review because their customer service has consistently exceeded my expectations. My journey started when I called to ask about availability in my area. The sales rep I spoke with was knowledgeable, patient with all my questions, and didn't use any high-pressure tactics. She explained exactly what speeds were available, the pricing structure, installation process, and contract terms. She even recommended the 500 Mbps plan instead of the 1 Gig plan I was considering, saying it would be perfect for my household size and save me $15/month. That kind of honesty built immediate trust. The installation was scheduled for the following Tuesday. I received confirmation emails and text messages with the technician's estimated arrival time. He arrived right on schedule, was professional and friendly, and took time to explain everything he was doing. After installation, I received a follow-up call from Frontier's customer care team asking if everything was working well and if I had any questions. That proactive outreach was impressive. About 3 months into my service, I had a question about my bill (just wanted to understand a line item - turned out it was the taxes/fees breakdown). I called customer support expecting a long hold time, but was connected to a representative in under 5 minutes. She was extremely helpful, pulled up my account immediately, explained the charges clearly, and even looked for ways to save me money. She found a promotion I qualified for that reduced my bill by $10/month and applied it right there on the call. The whole interaction took maybe 10 minutes and left me feeling valued as a customer. I also had to change my billing date once due to a change in my pay schedule. I used their online chat feature, and within 3 minutes, the agent had made the change and confirmed it would take effect next billing cycle. No hassle, no runaround, just efficient service. The proactive communication has been excellent too. When there was planned maintenance in my area, I received an email 5 days in advance explaining the maintenance window (2am-5am, so it didn't affect me) and what they'd be doing. When the maintenance was completed, I got another email confirming everything was done and thanking me for my patience. The speeds have been consistently excellent - I get 542 Mbps down and 546 Mbps up on my 500 Mbps plan. The fiber service itself has been rock solid with no issues. But what really sets Frontier apart is how they treat customers. I've dealt with multiple ISPs over the years, and Frontier's customer service is head and shoulders above the rest. Use Case: Work from home full-time (mission critical). Resolution Status: No issues to resolve. Churn Risk: Low - Very satisfied, planning to stay long-term.
